channel.title: StockHedges
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from StockHedges, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Coca-Cola CEO says McDonald's E. coli outbreak won't hurt beverage company's sales
item.description: Coca-Cola CEO James Quincey said an E. coli outbreak linked to McDonald's isn't likely to hurt the beverage company's sales at this stage.

item.title: U.S. Natural Gas Futures Mixed in Early Trade
item.description: U.S. natural gas futures were mixed with the front month edging up and winter months returning some of yesterdayâ€™s gains.

item.title: Gold Futures Retreat From Record High on Small Measure of Profit-Taking
item.description: Gold futures fell 0.4% to $2,747.70 a troy ounce. The precious metal set a record of $2,772.60 earlier in the session.

item.title: Treasury Yields Rise as Election Approaches
item.description: Treasury yields extended gains ahead of U.S. housing data, as markets expect interest rates to fall more slowly than previously thought.

item.title: New Boeing CEO sets sights on 'leaner' future as quarterly loss tops $6 billion
item.description: Boeing had released preliminary results earlier this month showing a big loss and $5 billion in charges across its defense and commercial units.

item.title: Deutsche Bank shares shed 3% as lender's swing back to profit fails to impress
item.description: The partial release of 440 million euros of litigation provisions in the third quarter helped boost profit, Deutsche Bank said.

item.title: Dow Falls as McDonald's, Starbucks Shares Slide
item.description: All three major U.S. markets were in the red while global stocks were mixed.

item.title: Coca-Cola tops earnings estimates, as higher prices offset sluggish demand
item.description: Shares of Coke have climbed 18% this year, raising the company's market value to nearly $300 billion.

item.title: Canadian Dollar Stays Weaker After BOC Cuts Rates by 50 Basis Points
item.description: The Canadian dollar stayed weaker against the U.S. dollar after the Bank of Canada cut its key policy rate by a large 50 basis points to 3.75%.

item.title: SAP boss warns against regulating AI, says Europe risks falling behind U.S., China
item.description: Christian Klein, head of German software giant SAP, says Europe risks falling behind the U.S. and China if it ends up overregulating the AI sector.
